column2: Question
1. School is a welcoming and friendly place.
2. I feel accepted for who I am at school.
3. Teachers make an effort to get to know me.
4. I have difficulty fitting in at school.
5. Teachers care about my problems and feelings.
6. I am proud of my school.
7. I am a valued member of my school community.
8. I think bullying is a problem at my school.
9. Students respect teachers.
10. My parents care about my education.
11. I have a teacher who is a positive role model for me.
12. Teachers care about me as an individual.
13. Teachers care if I am absent from school.
14. If I have a problem, I have a teacher with whom I can talk.
15. Teachers respect students.
16. Students respect each other.
17. Adults at this school listen to students' suggestions.
18. I am encouraged to practice good citizenship at school.
19. Teachers recognize students who are kind and helpful.
20. I have never been recognized for something positive at school.
21. I give up when schoolwork is difficult.
22. Teachers recognize me when I try my best.
23. Teachers let my parents know what I do well.
24. I put forth my best effort at school.
25. Getting good grades is important to me.
26. Adults and students work together to make our school better.
27. I enjoy being at school.
28. Teachers enjoy working with students.
29. Teachers make school an exciting place to learn.
30. School is boring.
31. I enjoy participating in my classes.
32. Teachers have fun at school.
33. Learning can be fun.
34. I feel comfortable asking questions in class.
35. My teachers present lessons in different ways.
36. At school I am encouraged to be creative.
37. I enjoy working on projects with other students.
38. My classes help me understand what is happening in my everyday life.
39. School inspires me to learn.
40. I enjoy learning new things.
41. I learn new things that are interesting to me at school.
42. What I learn in school will benefit my future.
43. Students work with adults to find solutions to school problems.
44. I like challenging assignments.
45. I push myself to do better academically.
46. Students are supportive of each other.
47. I am afraid to try something if I think I may fail.
48. Teachers help me learn from my mistakes.
49. I want to do my best at school.
50. I am excited to tell my friends when I get good grades.
51. Students have a voice in decision making at school.
52. I see myself as a leader.
53. Other students see me as a leader.
54. Teachers encourage students to make decisions.
55. Teachers are willing to learn from students.
56. I am a good decision maker.
57. I know the goals my school is working on this year.
58. I believe I can be successful.
59. I believe I can make a difference in this world.
60. Teachers believe in me and difference in this world.
61. Going to college is important difference in this world.
62. I work hard to reach my goals.
63. I am excited about my future.
64. I think it is important to set high goals.
65. I know the kind of person I want to become.
66. School is preparing me well for my future.
67. Students develop programs that improve the whole school.
